briefdescription.para: Maximum duty (100%) when configuring duty cycle as a fraction of period.

detaileddescription.para: Common PWM_control command code reservation offset. PWM driver implementations should offset command codes with PWM_CMD_RESERVED growing positively.
Example implementation specific command codes: #definePWMXYZ_COMMAND0(PWM_CMD_RESERVED+0) #definePWMXYZ_COMMAND1(PWM_CMD_RESERVED+1)
Common PWM_control status code reservation offset. PWM driver implementations should offset status codes with PWM_STATUS_RESERVED growing negatively.
Example implementation specific status codes: #definePWMXYZ_STATUS_ERROR0(PWM_STATUS_RESERVED-0) #definePWMXYZ_STATUS_ERROR1(PWM_STATUS_RESERVED-1) #definePWMXYZ_STATUS_ERROR2(PWM_STATUS_RESERVED-2)

briefdescription.para: Success status code returned by: PWM_control(), PWM_setDuty(), PWM_setPeriod().

detaileddescription.para: Functions return PWM_STATUS_SUCCESS if the call was executed successfully.

briefdescription.para: Generic error status code returned by PWM_control().

detaileddescription.para: PWM_control() returns PWM_STATUS_ERROR if the control code was not executed successfully.

briefdescription.para: An error status code returned by PWM_control() for undefined command codes.

detaileddescription.para: PWM_control() returns PWM_STATUS_UNDEFINEDCMD if the control code is not recognized by the driver implementation.

briefdescription.para: An error status code returned by PWM_setPeriod().

detaileddescription.para: PWM_setPeriod() returns PWM_STATUS_INVALID_PERIOD if the period argument is invalid for the current configuration.

briefdescription.para: An error status code returned by PWM_setDuty().

detaileddescription.para: PWM_setDuty() returns PWM_STATUS_INVALID_DUTY if the duty cycle argument is invalid for the current configuration.
Period in microseconds
Period in (reciprocal) Hertz (for example 2MHz = 0.5us period)
Period in timer counts

briefdescription.para: PWM period unit definitions. Refer to device specific implementation if using PWM_PERIOD_COUNTS (raw PWM/Timer counts).

detaileddescription.para: Duty cycle in microseconds

Duty as a fractional part of PWM_DUTY_FRACTION_MAX. A duty cycle value of 0 will yield a 0% duty cycle while a duty cycle value of PWM_DUTY_FRACTION_MAX will yield a duty cycle value of 100%. See Setting PWM duty above.
Duty in timer counts

briefdescription.para: PWM duty cycle unit definitions. Refer to device specific implementation if using PWM_DUTY_COUNTS (raw PWM/Timer counts).
Idle output level when PWM is not running (stopped / not started).
A handle that is returned from a PWM_open() call.
A function pointer to a driver specific implementation of PWM_close().

memberdef.definition: typedef int_fast16_t(* PWM_ControlFxn) (PWM_Handle handle, uint_fast16_t cmd, void *arg)
memberdef.name: PWM_ControlFxn

briefdescription.para: A function pointer to a driver specific implementation of PWM_control().
A function pointer to a driver specific implementation of PWM_init().
A function pointer to a driver specific implementation of PWM_open().

memberdef.definition: typedef int_fast16_t(* PWM_SetDutyFxn) (PWM_Handle handle, uint32_t duty)
memberdef.name: PWM_SetDutyFxn

briefdescription.para: A function pointer to a driver specific implementation of PWM_setDuty().

memberdef.definition: typedef int_fast16_t(* PWM_SetPeriodFxn) (PWM_Handle handle, uint32_t period)
memberdef.name: PWM_SetPeriodFxn

briefdescription.para: A function pointer to a driver specific implementation of PWM_setPeriod().

memberdef.definition: typedef int_fast16_t(* PWM_SetDutyAndPeriodFxn) (PWM_Handle handle, uint32_t duty, uint32_t period)
memberdef.name: PWM_SetDutyAndPeriodFxn

briefdescription.para: A function pointer to a driver specific implementation of PWM_setDutyAndPeriod().
A function pointer to a driver specific implementation of PWM_start().
A function pointer to a driver specific implementation of PWM_stop().
PWM Global configuration.

detaileddescription.para: The PWM_Config structure contains a set of pointers used to characterize the PWM driver implementation.

briefdescription.para: Function to close a PWM instance specified by the PWM handle.

simplesect.para: PWM_open() must have been called first.
PWM_stop() must have been called first if PWM was started.

parameterdescription.para: A PWM handle returned from PWM_open().

briefdescription.para: Function performs implementation specific features on a given PWM_Handle.

simplesect.para: PWM_open() must have been called first.

parameterdescription.para: A PWM handle returned from PWM_open().
A command value defined by the driver specific implementation.
A pointer to an optional R/W (read/write) argument that is accompanied with cmd.
The control call was successful.
The control call failed.

briefdescription.para: This function initializes the PWM module.

simplesect.para: The PWM_config structure must exist and be persistent before this function can be called. This function must be called before any other PWM driver APIs. This function does not modify any peripheral registers & should only be called once.

briefdescription.para: This function opens a given PWM instance and sets the period, duty and idle level to those specified in the params argument.

parameterdescription.para: Logical instance number for the PWM indexed into the PWM_config table.
Pointer to an parameter structure. If NULL default values are used.

simplesect.para: A PWM_Handle if successful or NULL on an error or if it has been opened already. If NULL is returned further PWM API calls will result in undefined behavior.

briefdescription.para: Function to initialize the PWM_Params structure to default values.

detaileddescription.para:
params
A pointer to PWM_Params structure for initialization.
Defaults values are: Period units: PWM_PERIOD_HZ Period: 1e6 (1MHz) Duty cycle units: PWM_DUTY_FRACTION Duty cycle: 0% Idle level: PWM_IDLE_LOW

briefdescription.para: Function to set the duty cycle of the specified PWM handle. PWM instances run in active high output mode; 0% is always low output, 100% is always high output. This API can be called while the PWM is running & duty must always be lower than or equal to the period. If an error occurs while calling the function the PWM duty cycle will remain unchanged.

simplesect.para: PWM_open() must have been called first.

parameterdescription.para: A PWM handle returned from PWM_open().
Duty cycle in the units and format specified by the params used in PWM_open().
The duty was set successfully.
The duty was not set and remains unchanged.

briefdescription.para: Function to set the period of the specified PWM handle. This API can be called while the PWM is running & the period must always be larger than the duty cycle. If an error occurs while calling the function the PWM period will remain unchanged.

simplesect.para: PWM_open() must have been called first.

parameterdescription.para: A PWM handle returned from PWM_open().
Period in the units specified by the params used in PWM_open().
The period was set successfully.
The period was not set and remains unchanged.

briefdescription.para: Function to set both the period and the duty cycle of the specified PWM handle. This API must be called while the PWM is running & the period must always be larger than the duty cycle. If an error occurs while calling the function the period and duty will remain unchanged.

simplesect.para: This API should only be called while the PWM is running.

If the period is lower than a certain platform-specific amount, the output of the PWM timer may be paused to set these values. Some implementations may also pause the PWM if the remaining time before the next timeout is less than this value. This is to guard against an edge case where a timeout happens in between setting period and duty.
PWM_open() must have been called first.

parameterdescription.para: A PWM handle returned from PWM_open().
Duty cycle in the units and format specified by the params used in PWM_open().
Period in the units specified by the params used in PWM_open().
The duty and period was set successfully.
The duty and period was not set and remains unchanged.

briefdescription.para: Function to start the specified PWM handle with current settings.

simplesect.para: PWM_open() has to have been called first.

parameterdescription.para: A PWM handle returned from PWM_open().

briefdescription.para: Function to stop the specified PWM handle. Output will set to the idle level specified by params in PWM_open().

simplesect.para: PWM_open() has to have been called first.

parameterdescription.para: A PWM handle returned from PWM_open().

briefdescription.para: Pulse Width Modulation (PWM) driver.

detaileddescription.para: The PWM driver in TI-RTOS facilitates the generation of Pulse Width Modulated signals via simple and portable APIs.

When a PWM instance is opened, the period, duty cycle and idle level are configured and the PWM is stopped (waveforms not generated until PWM_start() is called). The maximum period and duty supported is device dependent; refer to the implementation specific documentation for values.
PWM outputs are active-high, meaning the duty will control the duration of high output on the pin (at 0% duty, the output is always low, at 100% duty, the output is always high).
This documentation provides a basic usage summary and a set of examples in the form of commented code fragments. Detailed descriptions of the APIs are provided in subsequent sections.
Once the PWM instance has been opened and started, the primary API used by the application will be PWM_setDuty() to control the duty cycle of a PWM pin:
Below demonstrates setting the duty cycle in units of PWM_DUTY_FRACTION to 45%.

If an application needs to modify the duty and period of a running timer, an API is available to set both with as little interim time as possible. This minimises the possibility that a timeout will occur between one set call and the other. For low periods or for instances close to timeout, this API will pause the instance output briefly and must only be called when the PWM is already running.
Below demonstrates setting the duty cycle to 75% of the new period (100us).

A PWM instance can be configured to interpret the period as one of three units:
PWM_PERIOD_US: The period is in microseconds.
PWM_PERIOD_HZ: The period is in (reciprocal) Hertz.
PWM_PERIOD_COUNTS: The period is in timer counts.

A PWM instance can be configured to interpret the duty as one of three units:
PWM_DUTY_US: The duty is in microseconds.
PWM_DUTY_FRACTION: The duty is in a fractional part of PWM_DUTY_FRACTION_MAX where 0 is 0% and PWM_DUTY_FRACTION_MAX is 100%. See Setting PWM duty above.
PWM_DUTY_COUNTS: The period is in timer counts and must be less than the period.

The idle level parameter is used to set the output to high/low when the PWM is not running (stopped or not started). The idle level can be set to:
PWM_IDLE_LOW
PWM_IDLE_HIGH

The default PWM configuration is to set a duty of 0% with a 1MHz frequency. The default period units are in PWM_PERIOD_HZ and the default duty units are in PWM_DUTY_FRACTION. Finally, the default output idle level is PWM_IDLE_LOW. It is the application's responsibility to set the duty for each PWM output used.
Refer to the Driver's Configuration section for driver configuration information.
